definition: to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow

sentences.english: It's a shocking incident but in some ways understandable.
sentences.chinese: 这似乎骇人听闻，但从某种意义上说也完全可以理解。

sentences.english: It's absolutely appalling, I'm trembling with anger.
sentences.chinese: 这绝对是骇人听闻的，我气得直发抖。

sentences.english: My mother’s bank manager gave her appalling advice, " said one well-connected woman.
sentences.chinese: 我母亲的银行经理给出的建议骇人听闻。

sentences.english: This is an outrage, yet no one seems to know or care about it.
sentences.chinese: 这是骇人听闻的事件，然而似乎没有人知道或在乎。

sentences.english: The Inquisition of the Medieval Ages devised many demoniac means of torture.
sentences.chinese: 中世纪的宗教法庭创造了许多骇人听闻的酷刑。

sentences.english: Nothing can extenuate such appalling behavior.
sentences.chinese: 这种骇人听闻的行径罪不可恕。

sentences.english: However, the lack of sex education has led to some shocking stories.
sentences.chinese: 然而，性教育的缺失已经导致一些骇人听闻的故事。

definition: to sensationalize (idiom); deliberate exaggeration to scare people
to make one's hair stand up in anger (idiom); to raise people's hackles
universally shocking/to offend the whole of society
to be devoid of all humanity/inhuman/bestial
unheard of/an extremely rare and unprecedented event
lit. shocks the eye, astonishes the heart (idiom); shocking/horrible to see/a ghastly sight
